## Lectures Queuing Theory

Poisson distribution

```{python}
import numpy as np
import math
import plotly.express as px
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

l = 1

u = np.arange(10)
P = np.array([math.exp(-1*l*num) for num in u])
print(P)
fig = px.line(x=u, y=P, title=r"$P(U_i \geq u)=e^{- \lambda u}$")
fig.show()
```
